field.hint: Enter at least the year of publication, month and day are optional.

field.label: Publisher
field.hint: Optionally enter the publisher here.

field.label: Part of
field.hint: The publication where this publication is included. E.g. a book chapter lists here the book, a contribution to a conference lists here the conference proceeding.

field.label: ISBN (of the container)
field.hint: If the publication has an ISBN (International Standard Book Number), please enter it here.

field.label: DOI (of the container)
field.hint: If the publication has a DOI, please enter it here.

field.label: In Journal or Serie
field.hint: The journal or serie where this publication has been published.

field.hint: INID code 21 (DE), 96 (EP), 86 (WO) for this item

field.label: The organisation meets the EU definition of an SME
field.hint: According to EU state aid law: The category of micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) is made up of companies that employ fewer than 250 people and either have an annual turnover not exceeding EUR 50 million or an annual balance sheet total not exceeding EUR 43 million.

field.label: The organisation corresponds to the German definition of an Medium-sized businesses (but not the EU-Definition of an KMU)
field.hint: German definition of medium-sized companies: Up to 1,000 employees and an annual turnover of € 100 million. Please select only "Yes" if you do not fall under the EU definition of an SME.

field.hint: Please enter the correct title or at least a working title. If the project is funded, an update from profi will follow.

field.hint: Which stakeholder groups are involved or addressed by the social innovation/ use of results?

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Type and stakeholder groups of the solution, change or innovation
Description of the solution / change / innovation (incl. benefits and possible market potential or size of the user group)
Degree of novelty
field.hint: Please give an overview which attributes are essential, to implement the social innovation. Describe, which applicability of the social innovation/ change process the project reached.

field.label: Efficiency of the solution - ratio of effort and benefit
Information about Readiness Level
field.hint: Please describe the actual, the intended and at the end of the project the reached Solution-Readiness-Level.

field.label: Status of SRL
field.hint: Choose the status of your description.

field.label: Description of Readiness Level
field.hint: Please indicate here (if necessary), specific aspects, interdependences or uncertainities, regarding the SRL-level of the solution.

field.label: Customer / Usergroup
field.hint: Select which stakeholder groups are potential customers or users?

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Related innovation
field.hint: Please choose an intended innovationl. If there is no relation to an already described innovation potential, please leave the field empty and add information in the section "innovation type".

field.label: Type of innovation and customer/ user group
field.hint: You can choose as much areas as required.

field.label: Description of the solution, change or innovation
Unit (Selection list)
field.hint: Please choose a suitable unit or enter a new one.

field.label: Free-defined unit
field.hint: Please enter a unit, if predefined ones does not fit.

field.label: Quantification and development of the application success
field.hint: Please provide details about the scope and development of the application success, if possible.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Description of the result or problem, "lessons learned" and recommendations
field.hint: Please describe the result and which "lessons learned" and recommendations you derive from it. (e.g. questioning the state of research, in-depth investigations, hints for a modified experimental procedure)

field.label: Is a publication planned or has it been done already?
Information on the planned publication or reservations regarding the publication of relevant "negative results"
field.hint: Indicate in which form (e.g. in a database, a journal, a practice journal) and in which time period a publication is planned. If necessary, add explanations, e.g. whether the "negative results" will be the main content or a secondary result in the publication. Or describe your reservations about publishing relevant "negative results".

field.label: Link to a publication
field.hint: Publications that have already been recorded for the project can be selected. If the relevant publication is still missing from the list, please add it in the "Publication" section and then assign it here.

field.label: Nature of the project's participation in the event
Title
field.hint: If no specific title exists yet, choose a title that clarifies the nature of the event. (e.g. by specifying the topic, format, purpose and addressed stakeholder group).

field.label: Please describe what the event is for in the project (max. 3 specifications).
Involved organisations
field.hint: Please select one or more organisation(s).

field.label: Stakeholder groups involved
field.hint: Please select one or more stakeholder group(s).

field.label: Additional description of the event
field.hint: If necessary, add here further information about the event that you consider to be essential. For example topics, specific methods, procedures, peculiarities of the participating organizations or groups of actors or the importance of the event for the impact of the project.

field.label: Start date
field.hint: Please select the start date via the calendar, manual entry is not possible.

field.label: End date
field.hint: Please select the end date via the calendar, manual entry is not possible.

field.label: Total duration (h)
field.hint: Please indicate the total duration of the event/interaction in hours.

field.label: Number of participants
field.hint: Please characterise the event/interaction by giving an approximate number of participants.

field.label: Key information / title of the process of cooperation, participation and working together
field.hint: Please state a title that clarifies the nature of the process (e.g. by specifying the topic, format, purpose and stakeholder group involved).

field.label: Purposes of the interaction
field.hint: Please select one or several purposes of the activity.

field.label: Involved organisations
field.hint: Please select one or more organisation(s).

field.label: Stakeholder groups involved
field.hint: Please select one or more stakeholder group(s).

field.label: Duration (h)
field.hint: Please indicate the average duration per interaction/event in hours.

field.label: Frequency
field.hint: Please select a frequency for interactions/events that take place relatively continuously throughout the project. If you select phased, you can enter a number in the next field.

field.label: Period
field.hint: Please select the period for the interactions/events.

field.label: Start date
field.hint: Please select the start date via the calendar, manual entry is not possible.

field.label: End date
field.hint: Please select the end date via the calendar, manual entry is not possible.

field.label: Total duration (h)
field.hint: Please indicate the total duration of the interaction/event in hours.

field.label: Number of participants

Title of the contribution
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the Title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Funding programme objective
field.hint: Please select the relevant (or possibly mandatory) funding programme objectives.

field.label: Contribution of the project
field.hint: Explanation of the contribution of the project to the funding programme objectives

field.label: Contribution of the project to a certain SDG target
field.hint: Please select as precisely as possible, ideally at sub-target level.

field.label: Description
field.hint: Describe the achievements for which the award was given and how it relates to the project.

field.label: Laureate
field.hint: If the prize goes to a person, select the person(s)

field.label: Award-winning institution
field.hint: If the prize goes to an organisation, select the organisation.

field.label: Donor(s)
field.hint: Enter the orgaisation that awarded the prize.

field.label: Stakeholder group of the donor
field.hint: Assign the donor to an stakeholder group to clarify who is recognising the achievement.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a unique title, because this will be displayed in overviews.

field.label: Type
field.hint: Please select a type in which the object is most likely to be classified.

field.label: Short description of the object or material
Contact information for inquiries
field.hint: Because both contact persons and web addresses can easily change, please provide contact information as detailed as possible.

field.label: Web address
field.hint: Example: Link to a collection or to the website of the institution where the object or material is kept.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a a clear and distinguishabel title. This is imortent because the title is displayed in all interactions to which this stakeholder group is assigned.

field.label: Is the stakeholder group directly or only indirectly relevant to the project?
Why is the stakeholder group relevant for the project?
Societal area of the stakeholder group
field.hint: The basic classification of the stakeholder group into a societal area determines further queries, e.g. on the economic sector, the policy-making level and civil society

field.label: Select the economic sector of the stakeholder group
Select the addressed policy level (multiple selection possible)
Keywords for a more detailed description of the stakeholder group
field.hint: Please indicate by assigning keywords if the project is aimed at specific groups. (e.g. certain age groups, gender, physical handicaps, cultural aspects, nationality and orgin)

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Type of expected societal impact (selection determines subsequent queries)
field.hint: The selection of the type of expected impact determines further queries. (For ecological effects, the "ecological area" is queried, for all other effects, the "actor group" affected).

field.label: Selection of the direction of impact
Specific ecological area (multiple items possible)
field.hint: Input is only possible/foreseen in the case of expected ecological effects.

field.label: Selection of the group of actors affected by the impact
field.hint: No input is possible for ecological impacts. Groups of actors that have already been recorded for the project can be selected. If relevant group of actors are missing, please add them in the section "Group of actors" and then assign them here.

field.label: Description and, if applicable, quantification of the expected impact
field.hint: In addition to the description, please quantify the expected impact if this is required by the funding programme or if information on this has been obtained in your research project.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Description and Reflection
field.hint: Please describe the condition or requirement and how it is dealt with in the project.

field.label: Date from which the framework condition have an effect
field.hint: Please enter at least the year from which the framework condition have an effect.

field.label: Gender aspects in the research question:
field.hint: (e.g. Does your research question directly address a gender issue? Does your research question indirectly touch on issues related to differences between the genders)?

field.label: Gender aspects in the state of research:
field.hint: (e.g. Are there any gender specific findings in the state of research with regard to the problem addressed?)

field.label: Gender relevance in research and project design:
field.hint: (e.g. Is the category gender systematically taken into account in data collection and/or methods? Are gender aspects considered in the interactions?)

field.label: Gender aspects regarding the application and impact of R&D results:
field.hint: (e.g. Are women a relevant user group of the results? Were gender-specific aspects taken into account when developing a innovation/ application)

field.label: Implementation of gender equality:
field.hint: What is the project doing to directly contribute to the equality of women and men employed in the project (complementary to the legal regulations for hiring staff)?

field.label: Key message on the consideration of gender aspects in the project
Selection of relevant ethical aspects and description of measures for dealing with them appropriately
Key messageof the ethical reflection
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and easily understandable title, because this will be displayed in overviews.

field.label: Title
field.hint: Please formulate a clear and distinguishable title. This is important because the title is displayed in overviews.

field.label: Summary
field.hint: Please give a brief summary of the main findings.

pair.stored-value: intended to reach at the end of the project

pair.displayed-value: SRL 1 - scientific research results show the basic functional principles and relationships. No statements can be made about the transferability to a field of application.
SRL 2 - Problem and application relevance of the results were established theoretically (inner-scientific concept development)
SRL 3 - Problem and application relevance have been demonstrated in small experiments or studies and/or were designed through participative processes with relevant actors groups
SRL 4 - Tests close to reality prove the applicability and the solution potential. Obstacles/deficits regarding the applicability can be described. A further development seems promising.
SRL 5 - A further development could eliminate identified obstacles/deficits regarding the applicability. Eventually, this has already been demonstrated by a re-test.
SRL 6 - exemplary application/testing in a specific field of application within the project or by external actors
SRL 7 - Manifold model application/testing in different fields of application.
SRL 8 - First application or pilot operation under completely realistic conditions.
SRL 9 - Proven applications and suitable framework conditions show the suitability for widespread use.
TRL 5 – technology validated in relevant environment (industrially relevant environment in the case of key enabling technologies)
TRL 6 – technology demonstrated in relevant environment (industrially relevantenvironment in the case of key enabling technologies)
TRL 7 – system prototype demonstration in operational environment
TRL 9 – actual system proven in operational environment (competitive manufacturing in the case of key enabling technologies; or in space)
